headline: 'The Five' recap Thanksgiving
subHeadline: Hosts share photos, stories from their Turkey Day celebrations.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Best hair in the business.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's the best hair. And then I have some guests, I have this fellow came over later. It wasn't green when he got there, but by the end of the night, he was green. And then this guy showed up right there right here, landed on my roof, brought him in.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Beautiful.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah, quite beautiful. And then, this woman just happened to be sitting in the corner.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Is that your aunt?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I have no idea who she is.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Not related.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And then later we have -- this is my collection of rubber duckies, because on Thanksgiving I just have one long bubble bath. And then, finally, finally, I was able to program my Roomba to deliver my booze. I mean, delivering my glass of chardonnay, which I'm not a big fan of.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: My Roomba doesn't know. Well, am I going to punish a robot?   KIMBERLY GUILFOYLE, "THE FIVE" CO-HOST: I thought you trained it to deliver your peanut wasp.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Chardonnay, very masculine, Gutfeld. Gillian, what about you?    GILLIAN TURNER, "THE FIVE" CO-HOST: So my family is celebrating on Saturday this year. That's tomorrow. So we haven't celebrated Thanksgiving yet. So instead, I thought I'd bring you some photos of Olivia and her best. This is Olivia two years ago pre-turkey. She's looking, lovingly. This is last year right before the turkey, so we've got before and after. This is the after from two years ago.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You really are going after's Dana's--

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.sentences: It is.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.sentences: When you sit on the sit. And then this, this is Olivia now looking forward to Christmas. She's really excited. That's her boyfriends. I didn't know I even sent that one.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Very cute. OK. And you, Jessica?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: And welcome to The Five.   JESSICA TARLOV, "THE FIVE" CO-HOST: Thank you, very glad to be here.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is your first time.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: It is my first time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Don't screw it up.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Greg. That's super helpful. So I'm from New York City. I was at home with my family. My sister and my new brother-in-law got back from their honeymoon the night before. So we talked a lot about their trip. But we were just at home. I only have a couple shots. We're not a massive photo family. So I wanted to share this one. This is my mother and my sister's golden doodle who have the same hair. You can't usually tell them apart. But the human one -- the taller one is her.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The human one.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: And then, my dad who is an amazing cook. Went to cooking school, makes his own bread. So I wanted to show everyone that that is going on at Tarlov H.Q.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Very needy individual.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.sentences: Oh, look at that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And his a baker.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: He was a baker.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: So I watched the Thanksgiving Day parade, you know, with family and friends, and that was very nice because you could see the whole thing right where I was.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Undisclosed location.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Surprised I didn't out your exact address.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Exactly. And then, we had wonderful Thanksgiving dinner with my son and his father and his parents, grandparents, and we had the best time. And my friend Ann came, so roped her in for the whole thing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's great.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No pictures?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No pictures, Greg. That would reveal my location.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And all the celebrities.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Very good. I was with my family and my mother, when I got there gave me a make America green again bumper sticker and talked a lot about Gutfeld, as a matter of fact. She said your name is Gutfield. She doesn't know how to pronounce your name. She did not like how Trump did the turkey pardon. She felt that was insensitive because he joked about revoking the Obama turkey pardon, and felt that was mean and nasty.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.sentences: I agree with your mother.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And there's a lot of things about -- say about Al Franken, which I promised I would not share with the audience. All right. Next, Black Friday madness is officially on full swing on this -- the busiest shopping day of the year. Some frantic bargain hunters are coming to blows over the best deals. Check out these two brawls that happened earlier.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Let go. Let go.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Now, I don't know if you guys can see this at home, but I sustained a little black Friday injury here on my head wrestling a television away from an angry father at Best Buy, and just got a little band aid, so I'm OK.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Is that a true story?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Not a true story. Much more embarrassing than that I'm also not going to disclose. Gutfeld, these people are crazy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: If you ever want to argue against capitalism, show those pictures, because this is like 99 percent of these people don't even want that product. What happen is you -- you don't want the product. So they lower the price so you decide maybe you do want it. But you really don't want it or else you would have already purchased it. You wouldn't have wait and didn't fight. By the way, the worst part about this is every day should be black. I don't know why it has to be black Friday. I think that's weird. I think we should replace all holiday music with Goth music. Holiday Goth music, sister of mercy, Peter Murphy. Let's just make every day black.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK. That's why you're not in charge, Gutfeld.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.sentences: This is why that's not -- this is not your saying.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah, that's true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: But don't they have like cyber Monday and can't you get all these same deals on the internet?

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.sentences: All right. The truth? Are you ready?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Bring it.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.sentences: Every day from today until January 1st is going to be the same. There will be massive sales. I think black Friday is dead.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's over.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.sentences: Like you heard it here first on The Five--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.sentences: -- black Friday is dead. It's all a lie. From here going forward everything is massively discounted.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is fake news.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.sentences: This segment is fake news.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK. Well, it makes sense that I'm hosting it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Jessica, you would not be caught dead in one of these department stores, I can imagine.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: No, I absolutely was.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You would.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I love Best Buy.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Fantastic. I'll drop like that, right? No, I love going into Best Buy and running around. I did not pick up a TV today, but they now hook you with the emails early where they say, oh, it's starting. This is early black Friday. It's already 90 percent off, and then 90 percent off on top of the 90 percent off and all of that. So I did some online shopping, but no in person brawling.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And Kimberly has everything money can buy, so she doesn't need to do any shopping on black Friday?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Well, you know, it's just like any other day of the year. When you have Amazon it's kind of like aren't there always good deals?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Free shipping. And so far all I've purchase was, somehow, my son put in the card the Nintendo switch thing or something. These gifts keep on coming. You have to wait for this for Christmas, and then two bathing suits.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, nice.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Maybe this is a good thing because if technology is eliminating our ability to fight. But this is a good thing to remind us how to fight. This is important because we're too busy at home ordering things. It's good one day of the year to go out and fight to the death.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Get back to our roots.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Get to our roots.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I think you have no patients for that, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, no, no. I hide under a bed with spritzer.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And finally yesterday was Thanksgiving, but that didn't stop some football players from continuing to be anti-American. Collin Kaepernick spent the holiday at the annual un-Thanksgiving day protest on Alcatraz Island.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We're all fighting for our justice, for our freedom, and realizing that we're in this fight together makes us all the more powerful.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: But the former 49ers quarterback made a surprise appearance at the event, which commemorates the 19th month occupation of the notorious prison by native American activists from 1969 to '71. You have been out to Alcatraz, can I imagine.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They actually do this evidence year?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yeah. I mean, you know, but leave it to Collin Kaepernick to make it about himself and like try to ruin Thanksgiving. He's like the new Grinch, now he's going to probably move on to Christmas. Help ruin the NFL, drove the ratings down, also the profits. I mean, wow. When you see him coming, just run the other way.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Like bad news bears.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: There you go. What do you think?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I don't know if I'd run the other way, per say. I do think think--

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Unless he was throwing you the ball.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I would not also be able to catch that if he was throwing me the ball. I think this is an exceptionally bad P.R. move for Colin Kaepernick after he got the GQ citizen of the year award. I thought it was a great opportunity to, I guess, be more useful to people on both sides to make them understand what the kneeling is actually about, and what that all stands for, and also to be respectful of American traditions and things that are of value to a lot of people. So I didn't think this was a great thing. I didn't also know that it happened every year. So that's a bonus that I've learn something new

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: There we go. He's clearly going all in, Gillian.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.sentences: Well, here's the problem. I think if you want to fight and try to give a voice to native-American-Indian activists that's fine. But you can't fight everything all at once in one year. You can't fight the flag and the national anthem and Thanksgiving, like he's taking on too much in my opinion.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He's spreading himself too thin.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.sentences: He's spreading himself too thin. It's not a good move.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Gutfeld?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He's Mr. Potato Head social justice warrior. He just changes depending on the cause.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But you know what, the real sin is he chose Alcatraz over alcohol. Thanksgiving is about alcohol. But you know what a miserable Thanksgiving, Eminem. And the reason why he did an interview, he's enraged that Donald Trump has not responded to his angry rap, and therein lies the solution. That if you do not respond to this -- Collin Kaepernick will fade into certain obscurity. The more that we talk about it, the more he gets out of this. So Eminem is so upset because Trump will not even acknowledge that rap. And that is the best -- that's the best kind of revenge.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And it shows that he wanted the attention.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: he's jealous of LaVar Ball.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That's the problem. It's like, what about me? I'm over here.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: LaVar Ball for president.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He needs to learn how to tweet.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: LaVar Ball, 2020, Democrat candidate.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: He's like I wouldn't thank the president either. What about me?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Coming up, more Thanksgiving madness as President Trump spent Thanksgiving touting the success of America is his message to the troops. But some Democrats insist on ripping his achievements so far. We'll have more when "The Five" returns.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: While spending Thanksgiving in Mar-a-Lago in Florida yesterday, President Trump delivered this special holiday message via satellite to the five branches of the military serving overseas, highlighting the success of America under his watch.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
utterances.sentences: For each of you, I know it's hard to be away from home at this time of the year. We're doing well at home. The economy is doing really great. When you come back, you're going to see with the jobs and companies coming back into our country, and the stock market just hit a record high. Unemployment the lowest it's been in 17 years. So you're fighting for something real. You're fighting for something good. Now we're working on tax cuts. Big fat beautiful tax cuts. And hopefully, we'll that and then you're really going to see things happen.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: But, as you can imagine, the left would rather paint the picture of gloom and doom. Here's Bernie Sanders.

utterances.speaker: BERNIE SANDERS, U.S. SENATOR
utterances.sentences: I don't have to tell anybody that from a political point of view, this has been a horrendous year. It appears that almost every day there is something coming out of the White House that is embarrassing, that is destructive, that is horrific. Our job now is we enjoy this holiday with our family and our friends. It's not only to take on Trump's divisive actions, his desire to divide us up based on the color of our skin, or our sexual orientation, or where we were born, or our religion or whatever. Not only do we have to take him on, we have to do something else. And that is move this country forward.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: The president not one to shy away from his critics tweeted about his busy schedule today, quote, after turkey call I will be heading over to Trump's national golf club, Jupiter, to play golf quickly with Tiger Woods and Dustin Johnson, then back to Mar-a-Lago for talks on bringing even more jobs and companies back to the USA. Now he's very considerate to golf quickly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yet again, an example of his greatness, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yeah, that's right. And I'm sure he scored better than Tiger, and he'll probably tell everybody he did. Listen, I think there is a huge difference in these two people. Trump came out and said what was going well in America in the people's lives. The stock market, unemployment, jobs. And listen to what Bernie Sanders said. He said from a political point of view everything is a disaster. So he is just talking about politics. And from a political point of view, I agree. It's been a disaster for the Democrats. They have had a terrible year. He also made me fall asleep listening to him. He looked very comfortable. And I love everything looks gray, his hair, the sweater, the background. This is the leader of the Democratic Party. This is the leader of tomorrow. And I can't imagine the Democrats can be thankful for Bernie Sanders because, listen, the guy does not scream fresh when walking and talking like that. The guy is, I think his best days are behind him.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: OK. And also, thinking the military which is very important. Now Greg, I noticed something peculiar.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Not just about you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: It looked like Bernie has one of your sweaters.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's true. I was missing that gray one. And he better get it dry cleaned. I don't want that unusual socialist odor on it. You know, this comparison reflects the prison of two ideas. You know, in the media we're expected to be one way or the other. You're either on the Trump train or you think he's evil. And it creates this delusion that Scott Adams talks about, the two movie phenomenon where America is experiencing the same material, but they're seeing two entirely different movies. They see Trump as evil. Everybody else says things are pretty good. The fact is, the thing that makes me laugh, especially living in New York, an educated person on the coast who can constantly go about predicting a Trump apocalypse, a Trump caused apocalypse, will still go home back to a hip wine bar, peck at his iPhone, check his 401(k), and watch prices fall on technology that 15 years ago a king wouldn't be able to get. The things are pretty good and it's reality, as you were saying, in their face. There is no apocalypse. Things are pretty good. But in their head they're seeing an entirely different film, and everything is going to come crashing down and earth is going to burst into a ball of flames.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.sentences: A Trump apocalypse.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: As red as your hair.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.sentences: A Trumpocalypse.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: A Trumpocalypse. Yeah, very good.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We should play a drinking game every time you mention Scott Adams.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think at almost every show, right?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Almost every show, it's unbelievable.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Every other show.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Someone is keeping track of this, Greg. Let me tell you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He was right about Trump for -- nobody listened, including me.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Well, and there we go. OK. So two different world views.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.sentences: Two different world views. Quickly, I want to ding on both sides. I really don't think President Trump's message was all -- I think it had elements that were positive, but he was also kind of a downer. First of all, at 7:00 PM last night, he tweeted about the Affordable Care Act. These as families are sitting down to dinner. Well, crappy Obama--

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.sentences: That's not really the Thanksgiving puree.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.sentences: Also, he also said, and I wrote this down so I'd remember, he said to troops in Afghanistan, everybody's talking about the progress he's made in the last few months since I opened it up. Now, he also said to troops in Iraq, they weren't letting you win before. Now, this is demoralizing for service members who are there today, many of them who lost friends and colleagues over the last few years. Many of them who are actually serving tours of duty during the Obama administration.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Do you think they'll take it that way?

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.sentences: You can't tell these young men and women that their own country set them up to fail.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Do you think that they might -- they're taking it that way?

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: When I hear that, I hear like -- look, I'm making it easier for you to fight this battle.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.sentences: My point is that it's demoralizing. It serves President Trump's political purposes, but I fear it's demoralizing--

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: And they were serving and fighting just as hard under President Obama as they are under President Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But their hands were tied it's the point he's making.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I think that on Thanksgiving the president has to do everything better than everybody else. I expected this from Bernie Sanders. You expect this from the opposition party. That could have been Mitch McConnell in that same outfit if Hillary had won saying the same thing. It's the same slouch. His posture is pretty decent. But, yes, we'll give him a slouch.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He looks comfortable.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: But when the president of the United States says anything that could be interpreted badly, especially about our service members -- boast about being the best for the military all time, I think it's a problem. But I also want to say, Bernie Sanders did make a key distinction.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: What was it?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Where -- I will tell you. Where he actually didn't go into the policies that were problematic because we know about the healthcare bill and the tax reform bill which Democrats and a lot of Republican think are not good for Americans. But he was talking about the vibe and the rhetoric and where the country is that we're more divided than ever, and that's a product of the White House. I think it is a little bit more nuanced than it was just like this is all terrible.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So funny though as Democrat talking about divisiveness, they invented identity politics. They pushed that agenda instead of actually meeting the concerns of the American public about law and order, about terror, about border. Instead, they talked about pigment. They made pigment their politics. To the point about the military thing, this is an example of what the two movie scenario is. He says something and one side says, oh, my God, that's demoralizing. And the other side says, no, he basically saying that he loosened the screws so that they'll get more done. People see two different movies after hearing the same thing. Mine is right though.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.sentences: But the president did mention his celebrity friends. You might want to tell him.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Because he has real celebrity friends.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I have real celebrity friends.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Actually you do, you have a couple.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.sentences: Who are they?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Lou Dobbs.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Lou Dobbs and--

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Kilmeade.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- Kilmeade. Well, he's not a celebrity.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Ouch.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I love his new hair piece though.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yeah. He was supposed to be here for you today. Shame. Al Franken says he's sorry again for sexual misconducted allegations. But is the Democrat senator's latest apology enough? Details when we return. Stay with us.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Al Franken is apologizing yet again for alleged inappropriate conduct, as calls for his resignation continue to mount. This comes as two more women have emerge accusing the Democrat of groping. Yesterday, the senator issued this statement saying, quote, I'm a warm person. I hug people. I cross the line for someone in, and I know that any number is too many. I feel terribly that I've made someone feel badly and for that I'm so sorry. A spokesman said that Senator Franken is expected to speak with the media about this controversy on Sunday. So I want to start with a question. Do apologies matter at all in this? Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I mean, politics has turned this into a game of pervert chess. We take their rook. We take their queen.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Is Franken our queen?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know. Somebody says that they are sorry and means it, I'm inclined to always forgive because we all sin. You don't have to be religious to understand that there is redemption. And if somebody is truly sorry, you also have to put it in a sense of proportion and priority of the other accusations around. But, I can't say that because that apology isn't for me and it isn't for you. It's for people like Kathie Lee Gifford. His apology should be incredibly direct, very specific. It's not about greeting and shaking hands. It's about shoving your tongue down the throat of an unwilling participant. That's what this is about. So, as a start for him this weekend, he should direct his apologies in a highly specific manner. And, there might be people inclined to forgive him. I know Leann Tweeden, she forgave him when he apologized to her. And that's a start. You can't do these meandering apologies where did you go, you know, I hope that, you know, I'm sorry for the people who might have felt bad about what I did. You know, he said, "I really screwed up. I was a weirdo. I thought it was funny to shove my tongue down people's throat."

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Arianna Huffington, as well, defended him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

A man approached her car, introduced himself. Said, "I'm Johnny. Please stay here. Lock your doors. I'll go get you some gas. He went to the gas station and used his last $20 -- it turns out he was homeless -- to buy her gas so she could get on her way. utterances.utterance: For each of you, I know it's hard to be away from home at this time of the year. We're doing well at home. The economy is doing really great. utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: A Trumpocalypse. Yeah, very good.

utterances.utterance: We should play a drinking game every time you mention Scott Adams.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think at almost every show, right?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Almost every show, it's unbelievable.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Every other show.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Someone is keeping track of this, Greg. Let me tell you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He was right about Trump for -- nobody listened, including me.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, and there we go. OK. So two different world views.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Two different world views. Quickly, I want to ding on both sides. I really don't think President Trump's message was all -- I think it had elements that were positive, but he was also kind of a downer. First of all, at 7:00 PM last night, he tweeted about the Affordable Care Act. These as families are sitting down to dinner. Well, crappy Obama--

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: That's not really the Thanksgiving puree.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Also, he also said, and I wrote this down so I'd remember, he said to troops in Afghanistan, everybody's talking about the progress he's made in the last few months since I opened it up. Now, he also said to troops in Iraq, they weren't letting you win before. Now, this is demoralizing for service members who are there today, many of them who lost friends and colleagues over the last few years. Many of them who are actually serving tours of duty during the Obama administration.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do you think they'll take it that way?

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: You can't tell these young men and women that their own country set them up to fail.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do you think that they might -- they're taking it that way?

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: When I hear that, I hear like -- look, I'm making it easier for you to fight this battle.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: My point is that it's demoralizing. It serves President Trump's political purposes, but I fear it's demoralizing--

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: And they were serving and fighting just as hard under President Obama as they are under President Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But their hands were tied it's the point he's making.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: I think that on Thanksgiving the president has to do everything better than everybody else. I expected this from Bernie Sanders. You expect this from the opposition party. That could have been Mitch McConnell in that same outfit if Hillary had won saying the same thing. It's the same slouch. His posture is pretty decent. But, yes, we'll give him a slouch.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He looks comfortable.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: But when the president of the United States says anything that could be interpreted badly, especially about our service members -- boast about being the best for the military all time, I think it's a problem. But I also want to say, Bernie Sanders did make a key distinction.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What was it?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Where -- I will tell you. Where he actually didn't go into the policies that were problematic because we know about the healthcare bill and the tax reform bill which Democrats and a lot of Republican think are not good for Americans. But he was talking about the vibe and the rhetoric and where the country is that we're more divided than ever, and that's a product of the White House. I think it is a little bit more nuanced than it was just like this is all terrible.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So funny though as Democrat talking about divisiveness, they invented identity politics. They pushed that agenda instead of actually meeting the concerns of the American public about law and order, about terror, about border. Instead, they talked about pigment. They made pigment their politics. To the point about the military thing, this is an example of what the two movie scenario is. He says something and one side says, oh, my God, that's demoralizing. And the other side says, no, he basically saying that he loosened the screws so that they'll get more done. People see two different movies after hearing the same thing. Mine is right though.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: But the president did mention his celebrity friends. You might want to tell him.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Because he has real celebrity friends.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I have real celebrity friends.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Actually you do, you have a couple.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Who are they?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Lou Dobbs.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Lou Dobbs and--

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Kilmeade.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- Kilmeade. Well, he's not a celebrity.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Ouch.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I love his new hair piece though.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yeah. He was supposed to be here for you today. Shame. Al Franken says he's sorry again for sexual misconducted allegations. But is the Democrat senator's latest apology enough? Details when we return. Stay with us.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Al Franken is apologizing yet again for alleged inappropriate conduct, as calls for his resignation continue to mount. This comes as two more women have emerge accusing the Democrat of groping. Yesterday, the senator issued this statement saying, quote, I'm a warm person. I hug people. I cross the line for someone in, and I know that any number is too many. I feel terribly that I've made someone feel badly and for that I'm so sorry. A spokesman said that Senator Franken is expected to speak with the media about this controversy on Sunday. So I want to start with a question. Do apologies matter at all in this? Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I mean, politics has turned this into a game of pervert chess. We take their rook. We take their queen.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Is Franken our queen?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't know. Somebody says that they are sorry and means it, I'm inclined to always forgive because we all sin. You don't have to be religious to understand that there is redemption. And if somebody is truly sorry, you also have to put it in a sense of proportion and priority of the other accusations around. But, I can't say that because that apology isn't for me and it isn't for you. It's for people like Kathie Lee Gifford. His apology should be incredibly direct, very specific. It's not about greeting and shaking hands. It's about shoving your tongue down the throat of an unwilling participant. That's what this is about. So, as a start for him this weekend, he should direct his apologies in a highly specific manner. And, there might be people inclined to forgive him. I know Leann Tweeden, she forgave him when he apologized to her. And that's a start. You can't do these meandering apologies where did you go, you know, I hope that, you know, I'm sorry for the people who might have felt bad about what I did. You know, he said, "I really screwed up. I was a weirdo. I thought it was funny to shove my tongue down people's throat."

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Arianna Huffington, as well, defended him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes, that was different.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: There was a picture circulating -- yes.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Part of the problem is the apologies are not real apologies.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: They are statements in which these accused perpetrators are also making weak attempts to, like, justify their behavior and explain how all of this makes them feel. So like my pro tip to men who are guilty of sexual harassment and sexual assault is just stop with the statements, because I think they're actually hurting in a lot of cases more than they're helping. Charlie Rose, for example, Exhibit A, said he was, quote, "embarrassed" in his official statement by the claims brought against him. Well, guess what, Charlie Rose? No one cares how your predatory behavior made you feel. That's irrelevant to the conversation. Similarly, Louis C.K. issued a statement that was rambling all over the place, talking about rambling statements.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: At least it was in character.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: And he focused on how this was a learning experience for him.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: I'm sure that would be in his...

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: No one cares. That's not the point. As Greg said, apologize specifically to your victim and leave it at that. Otherwise, don't...

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: They don't know what victims are coming out the next day. And that's what's going on here, because it starts as one. Then we shoot up to four, and who knows? There could be two more gropings by the end of the week.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He should have a bit of an idea, right? I mean, in terms of...

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: He takes a lot of photos.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: But in terms of, you know, the conduct and what he's done. And so, look, he's apologized and said hopefully people, you know, learn from this. And including women to come forward and say if something has happened to them. It helps other women when do you that to understand and to feel courageous to be able to identify people like this that are, you know, behaving inappropriately and disrespectfully to women. I mean, so much for him running for president.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Dana's prediction. She blew that one.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Well, we don't know. Rehabilitation happens.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'd love to see Franken run for president. I think Franken and Trump is a great...

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Franken, Trump

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think his P.R. team is slick. And you first saw the slickness on the first one wherein they said, you know, "I don't think she remembers it the way I remember it." He's still kind of victim blaming. And now he's insulating himself against future claims where he says, you know, "I've taken thousands of photographs and hugged so many women." That's also saying that "what I'm doing is not groping, it's hugging." See how slick that is? So that insulates himself now further. I don't believe he will resign. I don't think there's a chance. And the Democrats have a problem now, because they're going to be asked about Franken every time they shoot across the other side of the aisle. And you talked about the other day, about there's no courtroom to judge all of these different things. And maybe for politicians, the courtroom is Election Day.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Let the voters decide, and that's how they're going to do it. As much as it pains me to say that, Gutfeld does continue to make a good point about this. That there's -- there should be a spectrum here. And because there's no spectrum, it's going to now -- he's lumped in with everybody else.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But when you look at what he's done compared to other people, maybe this is a survivable deal for a politician.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: I think that it may be. We need that spectrum. Coming up next, if Santa brought your kid a paper airplane or the game "Clue" for Christmas, would they be happy? Would they even know what they are? Why they may be the better alternative to this year's hottest toys.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Welcome back while kids across the world are writing their Christmas lists, asking Santa for some of this year's hottest games like fidget spinners, Hatchimals, and the Nintendo Switch. Some classics were also just inducted into the National Toy Hall of Fame. They include paper airplanes, the board game Clue and the Wiffle Ball. Aren't those, like, 100 years old? So what do my fellow "Fivers" think of 2017's newest inductees? Greg, you have more toys than anyone else.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Well, who doesn't love a...

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: What do you make of these inductees?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Not much. Who doesn't love a good lawn dart? I think that was always my favorite toy, but then they banned them. Look, the greatest toy of all is your imagination.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Aww.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Thank you. You can have your Frisbee or your Wiffle Ball. But you have no idea what games I'm playing inside my head.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, we do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They are horrible and strange, and they never end, Kimberly. Make it stop.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I just want you to get of my tree outside my window.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: You know all these guys at home are like, right, there's a tree outside.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: There's a tree. You laugh. He used to always make a joke about that. And everyone's like, "Whoa, where's the tree?" I'm like, OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Can't make that joke anymore.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No. You can't.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Kimberly, what do you think? Do you like these inductees? You have a little man.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes. No, I love Wiffle Ball, because you can play in the backyard and not, like, worry about breaking windows and so on. I love -- you know, I grew up playing sports and softball and baseball. So that's fun. Oh, and, also, the paper airplane. Now they have little foam, Styrofoam ones. It's like the best toy. Doesn't break anything, as well. Especially when you have boys you think of this. And they're -- little boys or, like, a Jesse kind of boy, still like to play with them.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Paper airplanes are affordable.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Paper airplanes, that's not a toy. That is a piece of paper that you fold and make some...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It is a toy. Use your imagination.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You can't buy a paper airplane, so it's not a toy.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Do you have to buy it for it to be a real toy?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes you can. They have Styrofoam ones.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They're talking about the classic paper airplane.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't know. I don't think so. Like the one we just make.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, which is made from a dead tree, I might add, America.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Not very environmentally friendly. Jessica, what do you think of the inductees?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: I think that they're fine, albeit the paper airplane was confusing to me. So I went back and looked at the whole list to see when Barbie got in, which was one of my favorites, and Slinky, which got in in 2000.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You like Barbie? That's kind of, I don't know, cisgender of you.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: It happens.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Sorry.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Cisgender?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We're looking that up now, too.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: The other -- but the thing to your point about the paper airplane. I saw that sticks was inducted in 2008.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Anybody can have one. (THROWS A PAPER AIRPLANE SHE JUST MADE)

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's pretty good.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: All right. So I want to just get your thoughts. Because the consumer advocates are warning about choking hazards that are in, like, all these toys now, and tech-savvy toys that are actually spying on kids. Like anything that connects to the Internet.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Like the Roomba.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Your Roomba is definitely spying on you. Be careful. Watch him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I like it when the Roomba watches.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: The Roomba is going to get a lawyer, soon.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Every toy can be a choking hazard. Army men can be a choking hazard. I loved army men. Remember you'd get the bag of army men? That was great. And it...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Army people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Army people, I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Both genders are serving now.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Have any of Greg Gutfeld's unicorns ever tried to choke you or spied on you?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Are you sure?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't like unicorns near me.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Are you sure?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, I am sure. And these Hatchables, I see that they're now...

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: No, Hatchimals.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Hatchimals? Oh, I thought they were Hatchables.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, my daughters have those.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: You don't know their name?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And they're genius, because you have to buy thousands of them. That's the key to making a good toy. One that you're just not satisfied buying one time; you have to buy the whole collection.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: That's like Beanie Babies.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: It was like that when I was growing up.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Or like American Girl dolls. Those are very popular.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Then you take them to the American...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Where are the American Boy dolls? Where are they? And why do they have to be boy and girl? Like why? What's wrong with you? We're perpetuating sexism and cisgender values. It makes me sick.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, you're not, because you love unicorns.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That is true.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Well, why don't you take a break, Greg? Calm yourself down.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I will.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: We're going to go to break. Stick with us at home, because "Facebook Friday" is coming up next, and it's the best part of the show.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Is it really?

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: It's my favorite.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Good old days, Bubble Yum. You could choke on that stuff. All right. "Facebook Friday." Susan M. asked a very important question: "What electronic or form of technology would you be willing to give up for a month?" And keep it clean. All right, Gillian?

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Bye, iPhone.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: I would just, like...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No way.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: ... dive in and do it. Yes. I've done it for, like, a week before, and it was the best week of my whole life.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Really? Really? And probably for other people, too. Because you annoy the heck out of them. Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I could give up TV. I could easily give up television.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I mean, I'd still have to watch "The Five." But besides that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And "Fox & Friends."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He has to watch himself.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: How could you watch "The Five"?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Huh?

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: How could you watch "The Five"?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I DVR it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What do you...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Sorry. I DVR it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I love him catching himself: "Wait, this is the industry I'm in. All right, give up TV."

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: But you shouldn't.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Jessica.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: I think my iPad, which I don't love, admittedly, but I'm trying to like more. So I feel like it would still be a loss.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes, iPad, computer. I would definitely not want to give up my phone. No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'd give up my abacus.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: My abacus.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Your electronic abacus?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I have one. Doesn't everybody have one?

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: But not your Disk Man.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Never. Not in a million years.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Because he's "Beautiful Mind."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There you go.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Abacus.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Marlena E. Ooh, this is also a very good question: "If you could be a newscaster in any era, which era would it be?" Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm going to go with today. Is that an option?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I think that's an option.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Either today or the '70s. You know, "Anchorman" kind of guy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You know, with the butterfly collar and the maroon jackets. I think I have a maroon jacket.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And the hospital bracelet on the right arm, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I told you I injured myself, and I'm wearing a hospital bracelet.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Too bad scissors weren't invented.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, I forgot.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Jessica, what era?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: I'm going to go '40s. I'm thinking a war newscaster, covering that. World War II would be interesting. That's late '30', early '40s, would be a great time for interest to do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: K.G.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What is it? It's what would you -- I can't read from there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You've already forgotten the question?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I'm looking at his injury, and to be honest I was looking at his injury and I was saying to myself, "That is really small. Who goes to the hospital for something like that?"

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It was potentially a cosmetic disaster. Everybody can understand that, especially you. It could have scared. It could have scarred. This is my livelihood.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He just loves him some pasta.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's my money maker.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: His paycheck is his face. Anyway, Kimberly, what era would you like to be a newscaster in?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Newscaster? Yes, it would be the same thing, probably back in the Ron Burgundy time. Then again, I feel like I'm there already, because he does wear that coat that he has. It's just -- you know. What can I say?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's a good point. There isn't a lot of progress in newscasters.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Correct.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They're almost interchangeable by decade. People who are newscaster -- local newscasters, even national ones, are the same. Anyway, Gillian?

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: I would enjoy being a newscaster in the day before television like when radio was in its infancy and you got to -- not only did you get to host the news but you got to, like, make really cool sound effects at your desk.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Ooh, that would be really fun.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Yes, right. And the bombs were dropping, like you get to do everything yourself.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Like "War of the Worlds" kind of stuff...

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: ... with H.G. You know -- H.G. No, Orson. Anyway, I would choose the witch trials. I'd shut that stuff down. I'd win a Pulitzer. I'd stop that stuff. That was the first -- you know, that's where the witch-hunt started.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Fake news.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: First witch-hunt.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: How would you stop it, though?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I would -- I would use my savvy journalistic integrity. I don't know what I would do.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So you'd be out of luck.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'd be out -- everybody would die, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You would do a monologue, until they burned them at the stake.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know what? I'm going to go to you first, Kimberly...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Go.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: ... because the question is from somebody named Kimberly. Ooh, and this is a tough question.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I didn't write it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: "Do you owe anyone an apology and if so, what are you waiting for?" Wow. That's a good game show question.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No, no, I'm not sorry.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're not sorry.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Sorry, not sorry?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Sorry, not sorry. And also not sorry to Jesse.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Wow. Jesse, anybody you want to apologize to?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: How long do we have?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's an hour long special coming up this weekend.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, we've got to go to commercial.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Gillian.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: I'll cede my question to Jesse. He needs it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Is this question that uncomfortable?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, like, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Do you want them to make something up?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I can do it. I would apologize to the entire world...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right. But you...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: For everything that I have ever done. Because I've annoyed more people per capita than any human being on the planet. I have made so many lives tedious.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK. What about the...

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: What about those things you said about Jesse's mom?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Apologize to Lou Dobbs.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm never going to...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The producers agree with you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The producers agree with you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. My staff, the producers, my wife, my family.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Wait, just on this show, you owe, like, five people.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Dana.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Dana.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Dana.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Start with the producers.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: What about Brian Kilmeade?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I would never apologize to Brian Kilmeade after what he did that weekend. All right. Am I still going? This is a serious question. Chris B. asks, "If you were one of the Founding Fathers, who would you be and why?" All right. Who wants this one?

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Me, me. There's only one answer.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Who?

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: George Washington.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Everyone is going to pick that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But he had wooden teeth.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Because he got to be president.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, but would you take that and not have wooden teeth?

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You would have wooden teeth?

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: To be the first president of the United States of America?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What do you care if you have wooden teeth?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It would bother me.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: That is the only answer.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'd have a problem with wood in my mouth.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: You should be less vain.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's not vain, it's just texture. I don't like wood in my mouth.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: You sound like Jesse Watters.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm going to go with Ben Franklin.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Good guy. Slept in two beds. Did you know what?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Why?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He liked -- he would get up from one bed and go to the other bed. And presumably alone, but we knew he was a wild man.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Maybe he liked cool sheets. And when one would get a little warm he would pop into the cool sheets and slip in between them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He invented electricity every night. Anyway...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's static electricity.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Jessica.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You're good at that, too.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: I was going to go Ben Franklin, too, but going back to the last thing, I actually have a person who I would apologize to, a girl named Flannery, who I went -- no, I went to school with.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's his last, not mine.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: You looked shocked. And I was mean to her in middle school...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Way to go.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: And she's a very successful cook right now. And I did not ruin her life whatsoever, but I was such a baby bully. Flannery.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I like people who admit that they bullied. Everybody claims they were they were the bullied. Or that they were the person that stopped the bully. But when somebody says, "Yes, I bullied." That's honesty.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: It's just me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes it's just you. Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I don't know. We already went to me first.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, really? Did we hit everybody on this question?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I already said George Washington.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I was going to say Sam Adams. Was he a founder?

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Because he got a beer?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I can't remember. I skipped that part. I skipped a couple of grades, for obvious reasons.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: "One More Thing" next.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Do you mean John Adams?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's time now for "One More Thing." I'll go first. President Trump just tweeted this. Ready? "'TIME' magazine called to say that I was probably going to be named Man" -- person -- "of the Year like last year, but I would have to agree to an interview and a major photo shoot. I said probably is no good and took a pass. Thanks anyway!" Wow, what a tweet.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, he's always closing. He's like, probably, maybe?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's the president last year. All right. So probably.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, who's next?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Isn't it me?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's me. It's me, but they moved the thing.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What happened?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Can't see. "Greg Gutfeld Show," 10 p.m. Saturday, I've got -- who do I have here? I've got the great Stephen Baldwin, the good Baldwin brother. And Terry Schappert and Kat Timpf and Tyrus, 10 p.m. Saturday. It's going to be awesome. Great show. All right. It's time for...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Greg's Nutrition Tips

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. The worst part of going to the movies are the movies. The second worst part is the cost of candy. This woman that I will introduce to you is a genius, for she fakes pregnancy to sneak food into the movies. She has -- that's a big dish, and she fills it with candy. It's a polystyrene bowl. And she sneaks that under her sweatshirt. I don't know if this is true. I don't know if it's true, but it should be true. It probably isn't true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You're a newscaster. Did you hear that quote? "I don't know if it's true, but it should be true."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That will be the name of my next show. "Doesn't Have to be True" with Greg Gutfeld.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. Kimberly Guilfoyle.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right. Well, tonight, I'll be filling in for my friend Sean Hannity at 9 p.m. Eastern, so I hope you join me. Great guests tonight: Alan West, Kayleigh McEnany, Geraldo Rivera, Gina Louden (ph), Charlie Kirk. We've got Todd Starns (ph), Doug Schoen, David Webb, Robert Jasper, and myself. And also Niger. So I think it's going to be a fantastic show. I know so. And also, it's time now for Kimberly's...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: ... Royal News.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Indeed. Where is my -- we had a situation. We had a mishap with the crown, so -- but don't everyone panic. We're going to fix it. OK, so here's some good news. There's love in the air, because it might be actually time for another royal wedding on the horizon here. A lot of speculation about Prince Harry and Megan Markel. The announcement should be pretty soon, I'm hoping. Bookmakers in Britain recently suspended betting on whether another royal engagement will take place, which could be an indication that the news is coming soon. A spokesperson for Buckingham Palace Friday refused to comment even to us, stating that they would not give a running commentary on Harry's love life.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Very interesting. Jessica.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Thank you. OK, so this is my favorite story of the week. It's positive for everyone. No politics to it. A young woman, Kate McClure (ph), who lives in New Jersey, ran out of gas driving on the interstate from New Jersey. She was going down to Philadelphia in October. She panicked, understandably. A man approached her car, introduced himself. Said, "I'm Johnny. Please stay here. Lock your doors. I'll go get you some gas. He went to the gas station and used his last $20 -- it turns out he was homeless -- to buy her gas so she could get on her way. She then drove away, very thankful, came back to visit the spot a number of times, dropped off warm clothes and food, and water, and started a GoFundMe page to help him get back on his feet. And it's raised over $300,000 now.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He's so rich now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's amazing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And it's so amazing, you didn't leave any time for your co-host, Gillian. I'm very sorry.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: As usual, Greg gets two things, and I get none.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Set your DVR so you never miss an episode.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What was your thing?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Have a great weekend. We'll see you back Monday. "Special Report" up next. END Content and Programming Copyright 2017 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.
